name: willow production, short rotation coppice | wood chips and particles, willow | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4189/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of willow wood chips (dry matter) in short rotation coppice (SRC) with a lifetime of 20 years. The moisture content at storage is 23% (=30% water on a dry mass basis). The SRC is harvested from the fourth year after establishment onwards every third year. The average dry matter yield of a harvest year is 36'333 kg/ha.

This activity assumes the production of willow in short rotation coppice with a plantation lifetime of 20 years and represents the average expenditures of the production of 1 kg of willow wood chips including the establishment, operation and clearing of the plantation. The inputs of seed, mineral fertilisers and pesticides are considered. It is assumed that no organic fertilisers are applied.


The dataset includes all machine operations and corresponding inputs of machine infrastructure and sheds. Machine operations are: soil cultivation, planting, fertilisation, weed control, pest and pathogen control, harvest and chipping of willow stems, transport from field to farm (2 km), drying of wood chips under roof (air drying; no electricity input), and clearing of the plantation by rotary tiller including growing of oil radish (not harvested) for shading the field and inhibiting regrowth of willow. Further, direct field emissions are included. This activity ends after mulching of the oil radish and with provision of willow wood chips at the farm gate.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/012:Growing of perennial crops/0129:Growing of other perennial crops

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The amounts of the flows are averages across all years of the plantation lifetime.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
The inventories were generated on the basis of data from the 'GruBE' project (Hölscher et al. 2007) and complemented with information from expert estimates, extension service documents and literature. The sources used in the project were KTBL (2006), Agrobränsle (2005), Hofmann (1998), Textor (2006) and personal communications from producers. --- Sources: Hölscher T., Deinmling S., Freiermuth Knuchel R., Gaillard G., Kägi T. & Müller-Sämann K. (2007) Energieoptionen aus landwirtschaftlicher Biomasse am Oberrhein - Auswirkungen für Landwirtschaft und Umwelt - Endbericht zum Projekt. Agentur für Nachhaltige Nutzung von Agrarlandschaften (ANNA). Müllheim, Germany. --- KTBL (2006) Energiepflanzen. Daten für die Planung des Energiepflanzenanbaus. Kuratorium für Technik und Bauwesen in der Landwirtschaft, Darmstadt, 372 p. --- Agrogbänsle (2005) Manual Salix viminalis. Ackerbauliche Informationen zum Weidenanbau. Informationsblatt der Firma Agrobränsle. Örebro, Sweden, 5 p. --- Hofmann M. (1998) Bewirtschaftung schnellwachsender Baumarten auf landwirtschaftlichen Flächen Kurzumtrieb. Merkblatt 11 des Forschungsinstituts für schnellwachsende Baumarten. Hann. Münden (ed.), 22 S. --- Textor B. (2006) Die Ernte forstlicher Rohstoffe auf landwirtschaftlichen Flächen im Kurzumtrieb. In: LAP, Landesanstalt für Pflanzenbau Forchheim (2006):Pflanzliche Rohstoffe zur
energetischen Nutzung. Workshop am 4.06.2006, Rheinstetten.

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of wood chips and particles, willow is calculated to be circa 1.07E-05 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: 'acetamide-anillide-compound, unspecified', 'glyphosate', 'pesticide, unspecified'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 2.13E-05 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'wood chips and particles, willow' is calculated to be circa 3.14E-02 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'lime', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'potassium chloride, as K2O'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 6.29E-02 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description: The exchange has been updated from 'potassium chloride, as K2O' into 'potassium chloride' and therefore its amount has been scaled (multiplied) from 0.0022 kg by 1.5829 kg of 'potassium chloride' per kg of 'potassium chloride, as K2O'. Original comment of the exchange is: 80 kg K2O/(ha*a) in the first, and 100 in the third to fifth harvesting years.
